This is the second of the legendary Moog albums of Popol Vuh after their debut "Affenstunde" and was released in 1971. 
 
"In Pharaoh's Garden" was the first true work of "sacred music" by Florian Fricke, guiding light of the mythical group Popol Vuh. Consisting of two extended works, his mixture of electronics and church organ with assorted winds and percussion, conjures up visions of the celestial light. Deeply emotional and filled with mysticism, this album marked the dawning of new age music, and still today is a wonder to behold.

Originally just with 2 tracks and now for the first time with more than 20 additional minutes, by adding 2 previously unreleased Moog bonus tracks of 1970/1971. 

This has been a cult album and will become a new one.
